title: Where to watch the Rugby World Cup 2019 – the best sports bars and venues showing the semi-finals across the UK
text:
The ninth Rugby World Cup, held in Japan, has reached the business end of proceedings: the quarter-finals.

After a tumultuous last round of group stage matches, eight nations, including the hosts, are still standing.

You'll need a good place to watch the action, of course, but it won't necessarily be easy, because Japan is eight hours ahead, meaning games will be kicking off early this weekend, at 8.15am and 11.15am. Not classic pub time, then, but a host of venues across the country will be opening up their doors in time for the crowds.
